author: hewman
title: Classic space gets a modern twist
review:
Being a classic space fan since childhood I had to get this fig. The design is beautiful, highly detailed helmet, excellent printing incorporating the classic space logo.

However, the colour of the fig is not what you see in the picture here but much more milky and the clutch power of the feet on the stand is a bit weak.

For $4 AU (the most expensive in the world I believe) this isn't great value, and because of that and the quality issue I'm not tempted to have a squadron of these, but it's a great fig for space fans to have one copy of.

author: washen
title: Cool, but a little too Asian...
review: I got this today at my local TRU (North Carolina, USA) and it's a very interesting little figure. It came in a thick polybay lined with silver wrapping on the inside. All of the components are made in China, which is a little disappointing, but it still looks pretty good. The blaster is especially cool and it features a new, slightly shorter trans blue stick to go with it. The pieces themselves feel a little bit cheap and the helmet is almost a mix between a regular and a rubber piece. All in all, I give this set a 3.5/5 because it does look nice and is great for anyone with a love for space sets, but the plastic is pretty cheap and the pieces don't fit together quite as well as good 'ol Danish bricks.

author: brixton
title: 3,2,1 Blastoff!
review: The spaceman is easily my favorite mini-figure from this collection.  He comes with a realistic looking space helmet rather than one of those motorcycle helmets that Lego tends to use for astronauts.  He is wearing a white space suit, which makes him kind of look like a NASA astronaut but all of the tubes on the suit make it look somewhat futuristic as well.  He comes with a ray gun that has been fired.  A laser beam shoots out of the gun.  You can take the beam out of the gun if you prefer.  He also comes with an extra visor for his helmet.

author: Roketah
title: Houston We Dont Have A Problem
review:
No build up just pros and cons

Pros...

  • New Epic Blaster
  • Laser Is Smaller Than A Lightsaber
  • Helmet
  • Price
  • Stand
  • 2 Visors
  • Looks Like An Advanced Clone From Star Wars

Cons...

  • Moronic Face
  • Facel Expretion Dosnt Fully Fit In Helmet
  • No Back Decals
  • You Never Know Witch One You"ll Get

5/5

author: vynsane
title: The NEW Classic Space
review:
As the first pics of the Collectible Minifigures hit the web, I already KNEW this guy was my favorite - SPACE has always been my favorite theme, and this guy is like a straight-up tailor-made Neo-Classic Space figure. After finally finding a Toys R Us that had them in stock, I ended up with FOUR of him.

Figures

This will be the meat of the review, seeing as how it's a minifigure in a bag. The Spaceman has an all-white space suit with printing on the front of the torso and legs. The torso features some intricate detailing as well as a new iteration of the Classic Space logo! The facial expression (as is the case with a lot of the Collectible Minifigures) is pretty hilariously cartoony, with a cocked eyebrow and 'heroic' grin to go along with his chiseled cheekbones. It's too bad they didn't print a second 'scared' face on the back, but I plan to mix and match heads anyway - I already put one of my 'Cowboy' heads on a Spaceman and vice versa - it looked pretty good! I think I'll make a Zombie Spaceman next.

Accessories

  • Helmet - The first non-dark blue/gray version of the new 'Space Police Commando' helmet, it has a good bit of molded detail around the chin.
  • Visor - Transparent Smoke looks good on this one, although Trans Orange would've worked as well. You get an extra in the package, too!
  • Raygun - Newly molded just for this figure (thus far, I'd look forward to seeing it more in the future) this gun SCREAMS 50's B-Movie Sci-Fi camp. Awesome.
  • Raygun Blast (3L bar) - Connect the Transparent Light Blue 3L Bar to show Spaceman in the process of firing his Raygun!

Conclusion

As Minifigures seem to cost $3(US) at a LEGO Store Build-a-Minifigure, $1.99 is a great deal for a highly-detailed, unique figure. People are complaining about cheap plastic, but I don't really see a huge difference between in-set figures and these. I like all of the figures in series 1, but this guy gets my absolute highest recommendation. I wanted to leave 'Build Experience' blank, so as to say 'Not Applicable' but you are required to enter a rating on each category. I didn't want to make it a '1' even though there's not much to the build, so I made it 5 across the board.

author: Crt2
title: My Favorite of Series one.
review:
First of all, The Figure may Look a little Strange from the pic above (Tall Helmet, hard to Pose.), But, He's, Not! The Printing on the torso is Fantastic, But Sure Enough, When You Move his Arm Forward You see.......Cheap Plastic. But For Me, It's Hardly Noticeable. also, The Gun is to Die For. If You Haven't Already Died over The 3L Bar! (LOL!) Another Thing, Some People May Say This isn't Regular White, But I Took The legs off to put on a Chef Torso.....& It Looked Normal! But Hey, Let's Go to The Pros and Cons:

 Pros

  • *Gun!
  • *3L Bar!
  • *White SP helmet!
  • *Spectacular Printing!
  • *Face is Pretty Good.
  • *CHEAP!

 Cons

  • *Cheap Printing........Sort of.
  • *As With all the Figs, No Back Printing. Which is Really Needed Here.

So in The End, I Can't Recommend This Fig Enough.

author: Brickmeister1138
title: Classic Space Strikes Back...
review:
General Info: The spaceman is an awesom minifig to have for any fan of Lego Classic Space, or the space theme in general. He seems to serve as an indicator of what the classic space theme would have been like had it been made using the art style of 2010 Lego. Nostalgia aside, this is an excellent figure; the detailing is amazing (especially the logo and space suit) and the parts are new and useful. The head is perfect for a cocky space hero from the classic serials and the raygun is very retro sci-fi. The laser beam piece is also excellent for short lightsabers in the Star Wars theme (known as shotos in the Star Wars Universe). The one big issue with this fig is that the bottom of the helmet obscures the mouth on the included minifig head and almost all other heads that I posses: if not for this flaw, I would have given this fig a perfect 10, but using another helmet of taking some small tools to the helmet could solve the problem.

(The plastic quality seems to be a bit worse than the normal minifigs, but it does not detract from the overall look of the fig in the least. The colors look slightly different than the traditional Lego versions due to the plastic differences though.

This minifigure is a must have for any Lego fan who is nostalgic for Classic Space or for anyone into the Lego space theme

Themes to use this fig in: CLASSIC SPACE.

Usabilty of Doubles: High (A starship crew for example)

Overall Score: 8/10 (Excellent)

author: P13c30fch33s3
title: A great way to replace your old space minifigs
review:
This minifigure is essentially a white astronaut from the original space sets, albeit with the SP Commando's helmet, and a new ray gun piece. The ray gun is a new piece, along with the shortened bar attached. The bar is basically a shortened lightsabre blade. This gives the effect of the gun shooting a laser. Because of the design of the barrel, you can also attach cones on it (like the old Star Wars guns). The ray gun also has two studs on the side. The only problems that i can think of for this minifig are:
  • There is no back print on the minifig's torso
  • The minifig doesn't come with an airtank piece, which would have made it a lot better.
Overall, i recommend this if you like Lego Space. It is nopt only a god addition, but also a good army builder to fill up large spaceships (e.g. Galactic Enforcer)

author: fergaj03
title: Spaceman to Brickset, Spaceman to Brickset, do you read me?
review:
Spaceman #1

I was lucky enough to come across a box of minifigures at my local store and this was the one I was most excited about. The possibility of combining this minifig with the one in the Traveller impulse set (7567) in a small spaceport diorama really appealed to me. 

I'm happy to say this minifig did not disappoint me at all! And, I am excited enough to want to try and find another. 

I think the printing on this minifig is very well done. The quality of plastic does seem a little bit inferior, as others have pointed out about the whole series #1, but for some reason the charms outweigh that negative. 

I love:

  • His helmet
  • The printing and design
  • "Neo-neo-classic space" MOC possibilities
  • The ray gun

I don't love:

  • The quality of plastic
  • The fact that I had to pay 2.99 instead of 1.99 at the my store
Overall, it is a great fig and a worthy addition to your space scenes. Happy building.

author: TheFadedTBCap
title: The Best Minifigure in Series One!
review:
I bought this guy just for his laser, but he turn out to be my favorite minifgure in series one.  His helmet is awesome and the laser is out of this world. :)

Pros:

  • - Laser is awesome and comes with a cool three studded blue beam
  • - Amazing helmet (just like the space police cammados)
  • - Really cool shirt with the Lego space logo on it
  • - Awesome and heroic face
  • - Comes with two visers, a helmet, and a laser

 Cons:

  •  - Could use a jet pack or oxygen tank

 The building experience is low cause it just a minifigure.  I really enjoy the Spaceman minifigure, I give him a 5/5

author: Agreenbrick
title: Simply great!
review:
The spaceman was the first of the figures that i really liked when i saw it. Because lego is not making that many simple lego spacemen that is not... too simple, and this figure was truly an exception. I don't have much of pros and cons here. All i can say is: You will not be dissapointed if you get this in your minifig bag! Awesome parts, torso and accesories!

An all around perfect figure!

author: Firox_5000
title: We come in pieces
review:
The spaceman comes in series 1 of the lego minifigure collection. He includes seven pieces and is extremly easy to build.

 

The spaceman comes with a laser beam gun which has a smaller light saber blue tube on. He also includes a helmet which is slightly different to the 2007/2008 ones as well as a detailed space suit printing on his torso and chest.

 

To make him even better he could have come with a jet pack and an opening helmet.

 

The only problem with the figure series is you dont know who you are getting and I ended up with three of these when I really only needed one or two.

 

The figure goes well with all space themes.

author: icepick
title: Pshew pshew
review:
I loved everything about this minifig.
(P)
Perfect redux print on the old space icon.  The coolest laser blaster ever to grace LEGO.  Sweet new 3L blue beam.  And I love his helmet.  I very nearly bought this just for that helmet.  : )

author: The_Mimed_One
title: The gold planet returns!
review:
This was back in the good days when you could FIGURE OUT what minifig you got, and when they cost only $2...The good days.

Good to see TLG paying homage to Classic Space, even if he is a far cry from the real CS minifigures. This opens up possibilities for more Neo-Classic Space, but I think nostalgic should
have been the route TLG went with the Spaceman.

Yes

The CS Logo
Steampunk-esque Raygun
Parts are workable for other MOC ideas

No

All the fiddly bits printed on

Dumb Laser-beam part

Helmet almost too big for minifig


I really thought that the Spaceman should have been one of the "winners"--Zombies, Spartans, etc., but I am glad to see that good ol' golden planet.


Thanks TLG.

author: sideswinger
title: A pretty good figure!
review:
So the thirteenth figure in the LEGO Minifigures Series 1 is the Spaceman, and for 2010, he is a nice figure. So let's get a closer look!

On top we have that helmet piece, and it does look nice. I like how he can hold it on that handle below the visor, and the piece is made up of two parts; the helmet, and the smoky-gray visor. The piece has some nice moulding along the bottom too.

Then we have his face, which I do really like. I like that confident smile, as well as his confident eyebrow printing, and the cheekbones look cool as well. It's just a very neat face, if you ask me. No alternate face printing, which is common for these two dollar figures.

Then we have his torso, which has some very neat printing. I love that classic space logo on there, as well as those cables plugged up. It's just a highly detailed print. No back torso printing either.

Then he has some excellent leg printing, possibly the best in the series. I love the belt, as well as the boots on the feet. Then he has those lines on his knees as well. Just some really cool leg printing.

Then his accessory is just that ray gun with the translucent blue rod coming out of it. It is an extremely common piece in the world of CMF, and is probably the worst part of the figure. Still, it's okay. The gun part os caste in a metallic silver. Still, nothing real special, but oh well.

And my overall opinion is that the figure is pretty cool, for a few reasons. First off, he has some very nice parts and prints, with the helmet and legs, and just visually looks neat. Second, he's just a classic idea, and was a very popular theme with LEGO, so I like how he's a callback to classic LEGO space. And third, he's just a great choice. Me, along with any other kid in the universe, always wanted to go to space, and just about everyone wants to be an astronaut. And while he isn't exactly an astronaut (we had to wait until Series 15 for that), he's close enough.

And that's it for this review! SO don't forget to check out my other Series 1 reviews, and thanks for reading!!!
